message: Let's get this party started. I want to know who's not using Sentry, and what your excuse is :)
I can not not use it :)
I am thinking on using it but I don't know what the penalty in resources will be. I guess I 'll have to give it a try and measure.
I am using it for http://creativespacehq.com/, it's so much better compared to the old ways ( apache logs + staff middleware ) Thanks a lot @zeeg and keep up the good work :)

Here at work we have 20+ sites reporting to a central sentry instance, it's great it really helped us, keeping track of hundred of email tracebacks was too painful for our team, so... thank you David sentry is great!
After looking at this topic and then looking for Sentry I can safely say we'll have a centralised Sentry instance very, very soon to go with my syslog server and Graylog instance.
It's useful but I was waiting for it to stabilize for awhile; with a fix for #81 I've been able to include it on all of my projects.
I'm working on making Sentry a standard part of the production stack we roll out for clients. Most of them I think don't know that they need it, but most eventually do. It's a great tool.
@zeeg I take it from the screenshot in the docs that Sentry now has a Nexus plugin as well?
@jacobian @zeeg: does Sentry support non-exception logging?
@steveivy ya it supports any kind of message logging -- we use it mostly for exceptions but also have a number of useless other warnings going into it
@steveivy there's a branch underway that does that (it's part of the 2.0 rollout as well)
It's definitely in my list of things to use in new projects, though.
The requirements say "Django >= 1.2", and for me, it'd be most useful in a project that's still running under 1.1 :(
@zeeg: i'm still not using Sentry, because i need first to clean/refactor the old (crappy ?) middleware code we are still using...
Does Sentry work on Python 2.4.3? I'm getting "SyntaxError: future feature absolute_import is not defined"
The thing stopping me from using it is the fact that it doesn't have a basic API that I can send events from other languages to. At least, I didn't see anything in the docs about that.
@leninyee I suppose that would be a reason it doesn't. I can remove those (they were for making my life easier developing in branches). Sentry 2 definitely requires 2.5+

@ericholscher In the new version the API is completely generic (we actually plan to pipe Java logs into it). Right now its kind of iffy as it requires a specific python serialization thats too much work to factor out
@zeeg So if I just remove every "from __future__ import absolute_import" line, it should work?
@leninyee ya :)
@zeeg Ok, got it, deploying it right now, thanks!
right now logging tracebacks to splunk.  But, I used django-db-log to good purpose on a previous project and would be interested to check sentry out in the future.
I 'm also on the sentry train since something like 5' ago
@zeeg One question though. I can see highcharts included. How does this work out with licensing?
@zeeg: can sentry be run in a single-server, single-django configuration, or do I need to run sentry on it's own instance of django, with sentry-client in my app?
You want the install section rather than the configuration section, confused me initially
@steveivy http://readthedocs.org/docs/sentry/en/2.0/install.html
@steveivy yes, you can run it all in one instance
pip install, add list to INSTALLED_APPS, add urls and run migrations
am I missing something?
after installing sentry, indexer and paging via easy_install and adding to a project, I get a bunch of failed tests
5 failures, 13 errors to be exact
running sentry 1.6.6 on django 1.2.4
Anyone? Bueller?
It appears to be an encoding issue, I'll see if I can get an example
You've given us everything but the error message.
https://gist.github.com/895437
O.o
Looks like your virtualenv isn't activated?
virtualenv is active...apologies for cutting off the start of the test run.
Hey, @zeeg, does Sentry hav a way of setting it up like a Nexus plugin or extension instead of on its own?
I was curious about running it under nexus as well...
@Kronuz @steveivy not yet, theres a branch but it hasnt been finished yet :)
